lines.text:
[in unison]
Mr. Wade? We're playing in Jersey City. Can you catch our act? We're the Morgan Twins.
When you're triplets, come back and see me.
You feel good, don't you? Don't you ever wake up at night and say to yourself, 'Maybe there's something just a little poisonous about me?'
Mind your business!

[With thinly disguised contempt]
You know, in a queer, crazy kind of a way I admire you. I like to watch you work. It's like watching the manuveurs of the atlantic Fleet... and after you've done something particularly mean and nasty, I'd like to take you in my arms and kiss you.

[a little taken back]
Hmmmp! That's a lovely unique. Is this the line you feed all those girls of yours?

[With slight sarcasm]
No, seriously, you're marvelous... a regular machine... no heart, no blood, no feelings.
[Helen's eyes begin to become more and more vulnerable as he continues]
I'll bet you never had a useless daydream in your life... never thought of a man. I'll bet you couldn't fall in love if you wanted to.
[He takes her into his arms and kisses her]

[the kiss has obviously released a well of supressed passion]
Oh, paul, Paul! You don't know!
But, darling, I do. I've known all along.

[Passionately]
No, you don't. I know what you think about me. There are so many things, Paul, I can't explain.

[Turning cold]
I tell you what, sweetheart...

[Vulnerably]
What, Paul?

[Coldly calculated]
Write me... write me in Duluth.
[She slaps him, and he smiles with satisfaction]

[Looking in the mirror at her new, very sexy dress]
Boy, if I showed up in Greenhill wearing this, they'd call out the fire department!

[Looking around the train station]
Wonder where that dumb partner of mine is. Boy, will I be glad to get him out of this town. Love has smitten him like a ten ton truck!
Never hits you, does it?

[Sarcastically]
Every other Thursday, Baby.
I've got a date tonight with a lady, a genuine lady.

[Nastly]
That'll be a novelty.

[With unintentioned irony to Helen and Katie]
You know, you're the only two sisters I've met who never quarrel. It's a beautiful thing!

[Last lines, leaving the hospital]
Well, whattaya make of it?
Oh, some little something went wrong. She couldn't take it.
Yep! That's the trouble with them rich ones. They have it too easy all their lives.
Yep.
